name: A2UI
summary: A generative UI specification where agents dynamically create rich interactive interfaces on-the-fly — not a transport protocol but a UI format. Framework-agnostic (React, Flutter, SwiftUI). The Whitehead promise is strong: agents that can show you what they're doing through real UI, not just text. But the risk is subtle: when agents generate their own interfaces, they also control what you see and don't see. The agent becomes both the actor and the set designer.

feedbackLoop.note: Agent generates the UI that displays its own results — it controls the feedback loop. Circular trust problem.

edgeCases.note: Rendering across React, Flutter, SwiftUI from a single spec means many edge cases per platform.

ambiguity.note: What UI an agent generates for the same task can vary. Non-deterministic presentation layer.

redundancy.note: Overlaps with AG-UI, MCP-UI, MCP Apps, Open-JSON-UI. Crowded space.

nesting.note: A2UI sits on top of A2A/AG-UI transport. UI spec within a transport protocol within an agent protocol.

exitCost.note: Early stage (v0.8 preview). Low adoption, low exit cost. Apache 2.0.

identityPenetration.note: Too early for identity formation. Developers see it as a spec to evaluate.

agencyPreservation.note: Users interact with agent-generated UI. The agent decides what controls to show — subtle loss of agency over interface.

controlInvisibility.note: Generative UI is inherently invisible control: the agent shapes your perception by choosing what to render.

crisisMindset.note: No urgency narrative. Google positioned it as experimental preview.
